intro: Govenia praecox, commonly known as the early govenia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Govenia praecox thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks.
